title: [Feature request] Open RemoteNg connection via a CMD in a new tab
author: xtipacko
body_snippet:
Hello.
I did not find such feature, which seems to exist in every other remote connection tool (like Putty, SecureCRT, Superputty). If it is not there, I propose:
Add to mRemoteNG a feature, allowing to Open a connection via a CMD in a new Tab.

Syntax could be like this:
`mremoteng --connection "/connections/interxion/myswitch123" --newtab`

Also you could implement new connection, like this:
`mremoteng  --host myserver.io --port 12345 --protocol ssh2 --username admin --password ADm1n -...

iterations.description: Currently, command line arguments are ignored if an instance is already running; IPC is needed to pass arguments to the existing instance.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): Currently, command line arguments are ignored if an instance is already running; IPC is needed to pass arguments to the existing instance.
Approach: Implement IPC (e.g. Named Pipes or WM_COPYDATA) in ProgramRoot.cs to send arguments from the second instance to the first instance. Update the main instance to listen for these messages and process them (e.g. open the requested connection) using the existing argument parsing logic.
